api_key.description: The API key to use for authenticating requests to the API. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_API_KEY environment variable. Conflicts with 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret'.

base_url.description: The base URL of the Tailscale API. Defaults to https://api.tailscale.com. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_BASE_URL environment variable.

oauth_client_id.description: The OAuth application's ID when using OAuth client credentials. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID environment variable. Both 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret' must be set. Conflicts with 'api_key'.

oauth_client_secret.description: The OAuth application's secret when using OAuth client credentials. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET environment variable. Both 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret' must be set. Conflicts with 'api_key'.

scopes.description: The OAuth 2.0 scopes to request when for the access token generated using the supplied OAuth client credentials. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1215/oauth-clients/#scopes for available scopes. Only valid when both 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret' are set.

tailnet.description: The organization name of the Tailnet in which to perform actions. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_TAILNET environment variable. Default is the tailnet that owns API credentials passed to the provider.

acl.description: The policy that defines which devices and users are allowed to connect in your network. Can be either a JSON or a HuJSON string.

overwrite_existing_content.description: If true, will skip requirement to import acl before allowing changes. Be careful, can cause ACL to be overwritten

reset_acl_on_destroy.description: If true, will reset the ACL for the Tailnet to the default when this resource is destroyed

block.description:
The acl resource allows you to configure a Tailscale ACL. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1018/acls for more information. Note that this resource will completely overwrite existing ACL contents for a given tailnet.

If tests are defined in the ACL (the top-level "tests" section), ACL validation will occur before creation and update operations are applied.

external_id.description: The External ID that Tailscale will supply when assuming your role. You must reference this in your IAM role's trust policy. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_common-scenarios_third-party.html for more information on external IDs.

tailscale_aws_account_id.description: The AWS account from which Tailscale will assume your role. You must reference this in your IAM role's trust policy. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_common-scenarios_third-party.html for more information on external IDs.

block.description: The aws_external_id resource allows you to mint an AWS External ID that Tailscale can use to assume an AWS IAM role that you create for the purposes of allowing Tailscale to stream logs to your S3 bucket. See the logstream_configuration resource for more details.

email.description: Email address to send communications to

block.description: Configuration for communications about important changes to your tailnet

email.description: Email address to send communications to

block.description: Configuration for communications about security issues affecting your tailnet

email.description: Email address to send communications to

block.description: Configuration for communications about misconfigurations in your tailnet

The contacts resource allows you to configure contact details for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1224/contact-preferences for more information.

Destroying this resource does not unset or modify values in the tailscale control plane, and simply removes the resource from Terraform state.

authorized.description: Whether or not the device is authorized

device_id.description: The device to set as authorized

block.description: The device_authorization resource is used to approve new devices before they can join the tailnet. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1099/device-authorization/ for more details.

device_id.description: The device to update the key properties of

key_expiry_disabled.description: Determines whether or not the device's key will expire. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: The device_key resource allows you to update the properties of a device's key

device_id.description: The device to set subnet routes for

routes.description: The subnet routes that are enabled to be routed by a device

block.description:
The device_subnet_routes resource allows you to configure enabled subnet routes for your Tailscale devices. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1019/subnets for more information.

Routes must be both advertised and enabled for a device to act as a subnet router or exit node. Routes must be advertised directly from the device: advertised routes cannot be managed through Terraform. If a device is advertising routes, they are not exposed to traffic until they are enabled. Conversely, if routes are enabled before they are advertised, they are not available for routing until the device in question is advertising them.

Note: all routes enabled for the device through the admin console or autoApprovers in the ACL must be explicitly added to the routes attribute of this resource to avoid configuration drift.

device_id.description: The device to set tags for

tags.description: The tags to apply to the device

block.description: The device_tags resource is used to apply tags to Tailscale devices. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1068/acl-tags/ for more details.

magic_dns.description: Whether or not to enable MagicDNS. Defaults to true.

override_local_dns.description: When enabled, use the configured DNS servers in `nameservers` to resolve names outside the tailnet. When disabled, devices will prefer their local DNS configuration. Defaults to false.

search_paths.description: Additional search domains. When MagicDNS is on, the tailnet domain is automatically included as the first search domain.

address.description: The nameserver's IPv4 or IPv6 address

use_with_exit_node.description: This nameserver will continue to be used when an exit node is selected (requires Tailscale v1.88.1 or later). Defaults to false.

block.description: Set the nameservers used by devices on your network to resolve DNS queries. `override_local_dns` must also be true to prefer these nameservers over local DNS configuration.

domain.description: The nameservers will be used only for this domain.

address.description: The nameserver's IPv4 or IPv6 address.

use_with_exit_node.description: This nameserver will continue to be used when an exit node is selected (requires Tailscale v1.88.1 or later). Defaults to false.

block.description: Set the nameservers used by devices on your network to resolve DNS queries.
Set the nameservers used by devices on your network to resolve DNS queries on specific domains (requires Tailscale v1.8 or later). Configuration does not depend on `override_local_dns`.
The dns_configuration resource allows you to manage the complete DNS configuration for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns for more information.

nameservers.description: Devices on your network will use these nameservers to resolve DNS names. IPv4 or IPv6 addresses are accepted.

block.description: The dns_nameservers resource allows you to configure DNS nameservers for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns for more information.

magic_dns.description: Whether or not to enable magic DNS

block.description: The dns_preferences resource allows you to configure DNS preferences for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns for more information.

search_paths.description: Devices on your network will use these domain suffixes to resolve DNS names.

block.description: The dns_nameservers resource allows you to configure DNS nameservers for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns for more information.

domain.description: Domain to configure split DNS for. Requests for this domain will be resolved using the provided nameservers. Changing this will force the resource to be recreated.

nameservers.description: Devices on your network will use these nameservers to resolve DNS names. IPv4 or IPv6 addresses are accepted.

block.description: The dns_split_nameservers resource allows you to configure split DNS nameservers for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns for more information.

compression_format.description: The compression algorithm with which to compress logs. One of `none`, `zstd` or `gzip`. Defaults to `none`.

destination_type.description: The type of system to which logs are being streamed.

log_type.description: The type of log that is streamed to this endpoint. Either `configuration` for configuration audit logs, or `network` for network flow logs.

s3_access_key_id.description: The S3 access key ID. Required if destination_type is s3 and s3_authentication_type is 'accesskey'.

s3_authentication_type.description: What type of authentication to use for S3. Required if destination_type is 's3'. Tailscale recommends using 'rolearn'.

s3_bucket.description: The S3 bucket name. Required if destination_type is 's3'.

s3_external_id.description: The AWS External ID that Tailscale supplies when authenticating using role-based authentication. Required if destination_type is 's3' and s3_authentication_type is 'rolearn'. This can be obtained via the tailscale_aws_external_id resource.

s3_key_prefix.description: An optional S3 key prefix to prepend to the auto-generated S3 key name.

s3_region.description: The region in which the S3 bucket is located. Required if destination_type is 's3'.

s3_role_arn.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role that Tailscale should assume when using role-based authentication. Required if destination_type is 's3' and s3_authentication_type is 'rolearn'.

s3_secret_access_key.description: The S3 secret access key. Required if destination_type is 's3' and s3_authentication_type is 'accesskey'.

token.description: The token/password with which log streams to this endpoint should be authenticated, required unless destination_type is 's3'.

upload_period_minutes.description: An optional number of minutes to wait in between uploading new logs. If the quantity of logs does not fit within a single upload, multiple uploads will be made.

url.description: The URL to which log streams are being posted. If destination_type is 's3' and you want to use the official Amazon S3 endpoint, leave this empty.

user.description: The username with which log streams to this endpoint are authenticated. Only required if destination_type is 'elastic', defaults to 'user' if not set.

block.description: The logstream_configuration resource allows you to configure streaming configuration or network flow logs to a supported security information and event management (SIEM) system. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1255/log-streaming for more information.

created_at.description: The creation timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

description.description: A description of the key consisting of alphanumeric characters. Defaults to `""`.

id.description: The client ID, also known as the key id. Used with the client secret to generate access tokens.

key.description: The client secret, also known as the key. Used with the client ID to generate access tokens.

scopes.description: Scopes to grant to the client. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1215/ for a list of available scopes.

tags.description: A list of tags that access tokens generated for the OAuth client will be able to assign to devices. Mandatory if the scopes include "devices:core" or "auth_keys".

user_id.description: ID of the user who created this key, empty for OAuth clients created by other OAuth clients.

block.description: The oauth_client resource allows you to create OAuth clients to programmatically interact with the Tailscale API.

client_secret.description: The secret (auth key, token, etc.) used to authenticate with the provider.

cloud_id.description: Identifies which of the provider's clouds to integrate with.

posture_provider.description: The type of posture integration data provider.

tenant_id.description: The Microsoft Intune directory (tenant) ID. For other providers, this is left blank.

block.description: The posture_integration resource allows you to manage integrations with device posture data providers. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1288/device-posture for more information.

created_at.description: The creation timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

description.description: A description of the key consisting of alphanumeric characters. Defaults to `""`.

ephemeral.description: Indicates if the key is ephemeral. Defaults to `false`.

expires_at.description: The expiry timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

expiry.description: The expiry of the key in seconds. Defaults to `7776000` (90 days).

invalid.description: Indicates whether the key is invalid (e.g. expired, revoked or has been deleted).

preauthorized.description: Determines whether or not the machines authenticated by the key will be authorized for the tailnet by default. Defaults to `false`.

recreate_if_invalid.description: Determines whether the key should be created again if it becomes invalid. By default, reusable keys will be recreated, but single-use keys will not. Possible values: 'always', 'never'.

reusable.description: Indicates if the key is reusable or single-use. Defaults to `false`.

tags.description: List of tags to apply to the machines authenticated by the key.

user_id.description: ID of the user who created this key, empty for keys created by OAuth clients.

block.description: The tailnet_key resource allows you to create pre-authentication keys that can register new nodes without needing to sign in via a web browser. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1085/auth-keys for more information

acls_external_link.description: Link to your external ACL definition or management system. Must be a valid URL.

acls_externally_managed_on.description: Prevent users from editing policies in the admin console to avoid conflicts with external management workflows like GitOps or Terraform.

devices_approval_on.description: Whether device approval is enabled for the tailnet

devices_auto_updates_on.description: Whether auto updates are enabled for devices that belong to this tailnet

devices_key_duration_days.description: The key expiry duration for devices on this tailnet

network_flow_logging_on.description: Whether network flog logs are enabled for the tailnet

posture_identity_collection_on.description: Whether identity collection is enabled for device posture integrations for the tailnet

regional_routing_on.description: Whether regional routing is enabled for the tailnet

users_approval_on.description: Whether user approval is enabled for this tailnet

users_role_allowed_to_join_external_tail.description: Which user roles are allowed to join external tailnets

block.description: The tailnet_settings resource allows you to configure settings for your tailnet. See https://tailscale.com/api#tag/tailnetsettings for more information.

endpoint_url.description: The endpoint to send webhook events to.

provider_type.description: The provider type of the endpoint URL. Also referred to as the 'destination' for the webhook in the admin panel. Webhook event payloads are formatted according to the provider type if it is set to a known value. Must be one of `slack`, `mattermost`, `googlechat`, or `discord` if set.

secret.description: The secret used for signing webhook payloads. Only set on resource creation. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1213/webhooks#webhook-secret for more information.

subscriptions.description: The Tailscale events to subscribe this webhook to. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1213/webhooks#events for the list of valid events.

block.description: The webhook resource allows you to configure webhook endpoints for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1213/webhooks for more information.
The 4via6 data source is calculates an IPv6 prefix for a given site ID and IPv4 CIDR. See Tailscale documentation for [4via6 subnets](https://tailscale.com/kb/1201/4via6-subnets/) for more details.

hujson.description: The contents of Tailscale ACL as a HuJSON string

json.description: The contents of Tailscale ACL as a JSON string

block.description: The acl data source gets the Tailscale ACL for a tailnet

hostname.description: The short hostname of the device

name.description: The full name of the device (e.g. `hostname.domain.ts.net`)

node_id.description: The preferred indentifier for a device.

tags.description: The tags applied to the device

user.description: The user associated with the device

wait_for.description: If specified, the provider will make multiple attempts to obtain the data source until the wait_for duration is reached. Retries are made every second so this value should be greater than 1s

block.description: The device data source describes a single device in a tailnet

devices.description: The list of devices in the tailnet

name_prefix.description: Filters the device list to elements whose name has the provided prefix

block.description: The devices data source describes a list of devices in a tailnet

created.description: The time the user joined their tailnet.

currently_connected.description: true when the user has a node currently connected to the control server.

device_count.description: Number of devices the user owns.

id.description: The unique identifier for the user.

last_seen.description: The later of either: a) The last time any of the user's nodes were connected to the network or b) The last time the user authenticated to any tailscale service, including the admin panel.

login_name.description: The emailish login name of the user.

profile_pic_url.description: The profile pic URL for the user.

tailnet_id.description: The tailnet that owns the user.

type.description: The type of relation this user has to the tailnet associated with the request.

block.description: The user data source describes a single user in a tailnet

role.description: Filters the users list to elements whose role is the provided value.

type.description: Filters the users list to elements whose type is the provided value.

users.description: The list of users in the tailnet

block.description: The users data source describes a list of users in a tailnet
